title: How to Reset Your Password
content:
If you've forgotten your password or need to reset it for security reasons, follow these simple steps:

1. Click on the 'Sign In' button on the homepage
2. Select 'Forgot Password?' below the login form
3. Enter your registered email address
4. Check your email for a password reset link
5. Click the link and create a new secure password
6. Your password must be at least 8 characters long

For security reasons, password reset links expire after 1 hour. If your link has expired, simply request a new one.

If you don't receive the reset email within 5 minutes, please check your spam folder or contact our support team.
keywords: password reset forgot login authentication security account access

title: Creating Your First Support Ticket
content:
Submitting a support ticket is quick and easy. Here's how to get started:

**Step 1: Navigate to Ticket Submission**
Click 'Submit Ticket' from the main navigation menu.

**Step 2: Provide Required Information**
- Enter your email address (required for updates)
- Write a clear, descriptive subject line
- Choose the appropriate category for your issue
- Select priority level (Low, Medium, High, or Critical)
- Describe your issue in detail in the message field

**Step 3: Submit and Track**
After submitting, you'll receive a unique ticket ID. Save this ID to track your ticket status.

**Best Practices:**
- Be specific about the problem
- Include error messages if applicable
- Mention steps you've already tried
- Attach screenshots if helpful

Our team typically responds within 24 hours during business days.
keywords: ticket submit create new support help issue problem request

title: Understanding Ticket Priority Levels
content:
Choosing the right priority level helps us serve you better. Here's what each level means:

**Low Priority**
- General questions or inquiries
- Feature requests
- Non-urgent issues
- Response time: 2-3 business days

**Medium Priority**
- Issues affecting some functionality
- Workarounds available
- Non-critical bugs
- Response time: 1 business day

**High Priority**
- Significant functionality impaired
- Multiple users affected
- No easy workaround
- Response time: 4-8 hours

**Critical Priority**
- System down or completely unusable
- Data loss or security issues
- Business-critical operations halted
- Response time: 1-2 hours

Please choose the priority that accurately reflects your situation. Marking routine requests as critical may delay response to genuinely urgent issues.
keywords: priority urgent critical high low medium ticket level sla response time

title: How to Check Your Ticket Status
content:
Want to know the status of your support request? Here's how to check:

**Method 1: Email Notifications**
We automatically send email updates whenever your ticket status changes. Check your inbox for updates.

**Method 2: Online Status Checker**
1. Go to the 'Check Ticket Status' page
2. Enter your ticket ID (found in your confirmation email)
3. Enter the email address used to create the ticket
4. Click 'Check Status'

**Understanding Ticket Statuses:**
- **Open**: Ticket received, awaiting review
- **In Progress**: Our team is actively working on it
- **Waiting for Customer**: We need more information from you
- **Resolved**: Issue has been fixed
- **Closed**: Ticket completed and archived

**Tips:**
- Keep your ticket ID handy
- Check spam folder for email updates
- Respond promptly when we request information
- You can reopen resolved tickets within 7 days if the issue persists
keywords: status check track ticket update progress open closed resolved

title: Updating Your Account Information
content:
Keep your account information current to ensure smooth communication:

**Change Your Email Address**
1. Sign in to your account
2. Navigate to Account Settings
3. Click 'Edit Profile'
4. Update your email address
5. Verify the new email via confirmation link
6. Old email will receive a notification of the change

**Update Your Name**
1. Go to Account Settings
2. Click 'Edit Profile'
3. Modify your display name
4. Click 'Save Changes'

**Change Password**
1. Go to Account Settings
2. Select 'Security'
3. Click 'Change Password'
4. Enter current password
5. Enter and confirm new password
6. Click 'Update Password'

**Important Security Notes:**
- You'll be logged out of all devices after password change
- Email changes require verification
- Keep your contact information current for ticket updates
- Enable two-factor authentication for added security

**Can't Access Your Account?**
If you've lost access to your email or forgotten your password, contact our support team for manual account recovery.
keywords: account profile update change email name password settings information

title: Common Error Messages and Solutions
content:
Encountering an error? Here are solutions to common issues:

**"Invalid Email or Password"**
- Double-check your email for typos
- Ensure Caps Lock is off
- Try resetting your password
- Clear browser cache and cookies

**"Session Expired"**
- This is a security feature after 30 minutes of inactivity
- Simply sign in again
- Consider enabling 'Remember Me' on trusted devices

**"Ticket Submission Failed"**
- Check your internet connection
- Ensure all required fields are filled
- Try reducing attachment file sizes (max 10MB)
- Refresh the page and try again

**"Access Denied"**
- You may not have permission for this action
- Contact an administrator if you believe this is an error
- Try signing out and back in

**"Page Not Found (404)"**
- The page may have been moved or deleted
- Check the URL for typos
- Return to the homepage and navigate from there

**Still Having Issues?**
If these solutions don't help, submit a ticket with:
- The exact error message
- What you were trying to do
- Your browser and operating system
- Screenshots if possible
keywords: error message troubleshooting fix problem solution bug issue common

title: Best Practices for Writing Support Tickets
content:
Help us help you faster by following these ticket writing best practices:

**1. Use a Clear, Descriptive Subject**
❌ Bad: "Help!"
✅ Good: "Unable to upload files larger than 5MB"

**2. Provide Detailed Information**
Include:
- What you were trying to do
- What happened instead
- Error messages (exact wording)
- Steps to reproduce the issue
- When the problem started

**3. Include Your Environment**
- Operating system (Windows 11, macOS 14, etc.)
- Browser and version (Chrome 120, Safari 17, etc.)
- Device type (Desktop, Mobile, Tablet)

**4. Attach Relevant Files**
- Screenshots of errors
- Screen recordings for complex issues
- Log files if available
- Maximum file size: 10MB per attachment

**5. Choose the Right Category**
Select the category that best matches your issue:
- Technical Issues
- Account Problems
- Billing Questions
- Feature Requests
- General Inquiries

**6. Set Appropriate Priority**
Be honest about urgency. See "Understanding Ticket Priority Levels" article.

**7. One Issue Per Ticket**
Submit separate tickets for different issues to ensure each gets proper attention.

**Example of a Well-Written Ticket:**
Subject: Login fails after password reset
Category: Account Problems
Priority: High
Message: "After resetting my password using the reset link, I get an 'Invalid credentials' error when trying to log in with the new password. I've tried on both Chrome 120 and Safari 17. The error started today at 2pm EST. Screenshot attached."
keywords: ticket writing best practices tips help effective support quality

title: Understanding Response Times and SLA
content:
We're committed to providing timely support. Here's what to expect:

**Our Service Level Agreement (SLA)**

**Response Times by Priority:**
- Critical: 1-2 hours (24/7)
- High: 4-8 hours (business hours)
- Medium: 1 business day
- Low: 2-3 business days

**Resolution Times:**
- Simple issues: Same day to 48 hours
- Complex issues: 3-7 business days
- Feature requests: Evaluated during quarterly planning

**Business Hours:**
Monday - Friday: 9am - 6pm EST
Saturday: 10am - 4pm EST
Sunday: Closed (Critical issues only)

**Holidays:**
We observe major US holidays. Response times may be longer during these periods.

**What Counts as a Response:**
- Acknowledgment of your ticket
- Questions for clarification
- Status updates
- Proposed solutions
- Request for testing

**What Doesn't Count:**
- Automated confirmation emails
- System-generated status changes

**If We Miss Our SLA:**
We take our commitments seriously. If we don't meet our response time:
1. Your ticket is automatically escalated
2. A supervisor reviews the case
3. We'll prioritize resolution

**Tips for Faster Resolution:**
- Respond quickly to our questions
- Provide all requested information upfront
- Be available for testing solutions
- Choose the correct priority level
keywords: sla service level agreement response time resolution support hours business

title: Security and Privacy Best Practices
content:
Protect your account and data with these security best practices:

**Password Security**
- Use at least 12 characters
- Mix uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols
- Don't reuse passwords from other sites
- Change passwords every 90 days
- Never share your password
- Use a password manager

**Account Protection**
- Enable two-factor authentication (2FA)
- Review active sessions regularly
- Sign out from shared computers
- Don't save passwords on public devices
- Be cautious of phishing emails

**What We'll Never Ask:**
- Your password via email or phone
- Credit card CVV over email
- To disable security features
- To click suspicious links

**Recognizing Phishing Attempts**
⚠️ Warning signs:
- Urgent language ("Act now!")
- Suspicious sender email
- Generic greetings ("Dear Customer")
- Requests for sensitive information
- Misspellings and poor grammar
- Unexpected attachments

**If You Suspect a Security Issue:**
1. Change your password immediately
2. Review recent account activity
3. Submit a CRITICAL priority ticket
4. Don't click suspicious links
5. Forward phishing emails to security@nesk.example.com

**Data Privacy**
- We never sell your data
- Emails are encrypted in transit
- Passwords are hashed (never stored in plain text)
- You can request data export anytime
- Account deletion removes all personal data

**Compliance:**
We comply with GDPR, CCPA, and industry security standards.

**Questions?**
Review our Privacy Policy or contact our Data Protection Officer.
keywords: security privacy password protection account safety phishing 2fa two-factor authentication
